subject: Re: keyboard/lexical set proposal
msgSnippet: A little anecdote about key mappings: Over the last few days I have asked one friend and two work colleagues who don t know anything about quikscript key
messageBody:
A little anecdote about key mappings:
Over the last few days I have asked one friend and two work colleagues
who don't know anything about quikscript key mappings to create a
mapping for the vowels and diphthongs using lower or upper case latin
letters. The only letters thay all had in common were :
'a e i o u' for the vowels in 'bat', 'bet', 'bit', 'bot' and 'but'
'R' or 'r' for the vowel in 'bart'
and 'w' for the vowel in 'bout'
(I was quite surprised by the 'w'. I asked each why they chose it, one
said that the end of the sound of the diphthong reminded them of
the 'w' sound, the others didn't know why they.)
